title: Europe cannot be complacent over people smugglers and must now galvanise efforts to tackle this pernicious problem
text:
The tragic discovery of 39 dead people found in a lorry container today graphically illustrates the risks that migrants take in seeking to find a new life in the UK and the ruthless role of organised crime in pursuit of profit. The immigration controls and checks in Calais have become more effective over past years through security investment at the port and technology.

The immigration authorities at Calais have specialised detector dogs, CO2 devices, x-ray machines for lorries and heartbeat detectors and vehicles having to wait in the quay side for some time before boarding the boat.
